unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain News Snippet: Vendor Audits Tightened Post-Diwali Spike**
normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain News Snippet: Vendor Audits Tightened Post-Diwali Spike**

unnormalised: New Delhi - Manufacturing firms across India are intensifying vendor audits in the wake of a noticeable dip in quality observed following the Diwali festivities. Experts attribute this to increased pressure on suppliers to meet seasonal demand.
normalised: New Delhi - Manufacturing firms across India are intensifying vendor audits in the wake of a noticeable dip in quality observed following the Diwali festivities. Experts attribute this to increased pressure on suppliers to meet seasonal demand.

unnormalised: Recent audits at textile units in Tirupur revealed discrepancies in raw material quality, prompting calls for stricter adherence to quality control measures. Similarly, food processing plants in Maharashtra, suppliers of ingredients for popular dishes like biryani, are under scrutiny.
normalised: Recent audits at textile units in Tirupur revealed discrepancies in raw material quality, prompting calls for stricter adherence to quality control measures. Similarly, food processing plants in Maharashtra, suppliers of ingredients for popular dishes like biryani, are under scrutiny.

unnormalised: "We've seen a 15% increase in reported defects in components sourced from vendors post-Diwali," stated Mr. Sharma, CEO of Bharath Industries. "This necessitates a more robust audit process, especially concerning safety standards and ethical sourcing."
normalised: "We've seen a fifteen percent increase in reported defects in components sourced from vendors post-Diwali," stated Mister Sharma, C E O of Bharath Industries. "This necessitates a more robust audit process, especially concerning safety standards and ethical sourcing."

unnormalised: Leading institutions like IIT Madras are collaborating with industry bodies to develop standardized audit protocols, aiming to minimize inconsistencies and ensure compliance with international benchmarks. The next round of audits will specifically target vendors supplying materials crucial for the upcoming Onam season products. These measures are expected to streamline the supply chain and prevent quality lapses.
